formattedAddress: 430 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 430 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

editorialSummary.text: Neighborhood eatery with an intimate feel serving a New American menu paired with cocktails & wine.

originalText.text:
A friend lives nearby and suggested this place so we went for a primetime dinner. Although we had a reservation, it did not seem that they were managing the Customer flow effectively and we were made to wait in the crowded front area for about 15 minutes, which I find unacceptable.

The room is quite lovely although it does get loud with a lot of hard surfaces, they have done a good job using the back windows to create the illusion of additional space. I had the burger for $27 which was good but maybe not $27 good. My husband had the rigatoni which he liked although for $31 the portion was kind of ridiculously small. We all started with the deviled eggs, which were quite tasty, priced at $16. Our friend had the chicken as his main course, and he loved it.

Overall, the service was a bit hectic, but the serving staff was working very hard to keep up with the demand. I don’t know if I’d be rushing back to give it a second try but it’s nice to know as an option in that part of the West Village.

originalText.text: Had a fabulous meal with friends on a weekday evening. Beautiful ambiance, and good service. We loved the spicy beef tartare, deviled eggs, and my filet was cooked perfectly. Will definitely be back!

text.text: Had a fabulous meal with friends on a weekday evening. Beautiful ambiance, and good service. We loved the spicy beef tartare, deviled eggs, and my filet was cooked perfectly. Will definitely be back!

originalText.text: Perfect! Everything we had was absolutely fabulous! Deviled eggs, endive salad, pork chops, and bolognese! We also had dessert! I cant wait to go back again and again! I’d highly recommend this place! And the service was outstanding!

text.text: Perfect! Everything we had was absolutely fabulous! Deviled eggs, endive salad, pork chops, and bolognese! We also had dessert! I cant wait to go back again and again! I’d highly recommend this place! And the service was outstanding!

originalText.text:
The ambiance was a 5. I loved the interior and decor, and was perfect for a night out, but I really did not like my main. The calamari and deviled eggs were excellent starters with nice spice and texture, however the crab/uni fettuccine was the opposite of what I was expecting.

The biggest let down was that the server did not describe the dishes well. When asked about items on the menu, she seemed to recommend items solely based on personal preference, but without any elaboration of ingredients or why she recommended it. When I was looking for a heartier pasta and going between the bolognese and uni fettuccine, she really pushed the fettuccine. I immediately thought it would be creamy, however it was tomato based and cancelled out any flavor of crab or uni. I also personally think that uni doesn’t necessarily go well with the acidic tomatoes, and if I knew it was going to be that, which was not mentioned on the menu, I definitely wouldn’t have considered it. All I tasted was tomato. Our server knew I was not satisfied, but did not mind. The other mains my friends ordered were good.

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Leroy House, and I must say it was an exceptional experience, all thanks to the incredible bartender, Max. From the moment I walked in, his engaging and friendly demeanor created a welcoming atmosphere.

Max is not just a mixologist; he's a true artist. The cocktails he crafted were not only visually stunning but also incredibly delicious. Each drink felt like a unique masterpiece, showcasing his skill and passion for mixology.

What stood out the most was Max's attentiveness to detail.  It's evident that he takes pride in his craft and genuinely cares about the customer's experience.

I highly recommend Leroy House to anyone looking for a memorable night out, and be sure to sit at the bar to witness Max in action. Thank you, Max, for making our evening so enjoyable. I'll definitely be back for more of your delightful creations!
